articles.title: Remodeling of May Day Stadium Completed
articles.content:
Remodeling of May Day Stadium Completed
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The May Day Stadium was splendidly remodeled to match the natural scenery of the picturesque Rungna Island. 
					The 150,000-seater stadium has football field, hall for preparatory exercise, bedrooms for players, room for coaches, room for referees, test and registration room and others to meet the requirements of international standard. There are also a swimming pool, table-tennis hall, mini-golf field, recovery hall and other sports and cultural and welfare facilities and service network built at the best level.
					
					 A ceremony of marking the completion of the remodeling of the stadium took place on Tuesday. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were members of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, officials concerned, players and coaches who proved successful at the 17th Asian Games and world championships, soldiers and builders who participated in the remodeling project, officials in the sports field, sportspersons, working people and youths and students. 
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea who is chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, made an address. 
					
					 He said that the May Day Stadium is a great structure remodeled thanks to the energetic guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un and patriotic devotion of service personnel and people of the country. 
					
					 He called for building more structures of lasting value for the prosperity of the country and the happiness of its people with the same spirit and mettle as were displayed in the remodeling of the stadium. 
					
					 He underscored the need for all officials and working people to conduct brisk mass sporting activities to raise a hot wind of sports across the country. 
					
					 He appealed to all the people to work harder full of faith in sure victory and optimism in order to bring earlier the future of a thriving country where people's dream and ideal will become a shining reality under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets with Presidents of Senate, National Assembly of Congo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets with Presidents of Senate, National Assembly of Congo
Brazzaville, October 27 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to the Republic of Congo, separately met and had friendly talks with Andre Obami Itou, president of the Senate of Congo, and Justin Koumba, president of the National Assembly of Congo, at the building of the parliament on Oct. 27.
					 Andre Obami Itou said the Congolese people who are ardently revering HE President Kim Il Sung who sent unsparing support and encouragement to the independence of Congo in the past are admiring the strong will of the Korean people who are advancing along the road of independence.
					
					 Justin Koumba expressed belief that Kim Yong Nam's visit to Congo would contribute to developing the relations between the two countries.
					
					 Present there were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, Choe Chol Su, DPRK charge d' affaires ad interim in Congo, and other suite members, Filmer Phouthi Soungu, first secretary of the Senate, Gabriel Obampo, chairman of the Diplomatic Affairs and Cooperation Sub-Committee of the Senate, Eteka Valere, first secretary of the National Assembly, Kigo Soungbi Josephe, second secretary of the National Assembly, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Justin Koumba gave a reception for Kim Yong Nam that day.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Expresses Thanks to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Expresses Thanks to Sudanese President
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of thanks to Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of Sudan, on Oct. 26, leaving Sudan after winding up his visit to it.
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam expressed thanks to the president, government and people of Sudan for the warm welcome and cordial hospitality accorded to him and his party.
					
					 The message referred to the fact that during his visit, both sides had a beneficial exchange of views on the issue of steadily and energetically boosting the bilateral relations and other issues of mutual concern and reached a series of agreements.
					
					 It noted with great pleasure that his visit to Sudan proved successful and marked an important occasion of putting further spurs to the development of the bilateral relations.
					
					 It sincerely wished the government and people of Sudan successes in the efforts to ensure the territorial integrity of the country, preserve security, develop economy and improve the people's living standard under the correct leadership of the president. It, at the same time, wished the president good health and greater success in his work.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Hartmut Koschyk, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Group, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Indonesian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Indonesian Ambassador
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, met and had a talk with Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell call on him Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Czech Republic
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Czech Republic
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Milos Zeman, president of the Czech Republic, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the friendly Czech Republic development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to PM of Czech Republic
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Czech Republic
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Bohuslav Sobotka, prime minister of the Czech Republic, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished him success in his work for socio-economic development of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Lubomir Zaoralek, foreign minister of the Czech Republic, on the same day.

articles.title: Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Visits Various Places
articles.content:
Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Visits Various Places
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Hartmut Koschyk, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Group, visited the Ryugyong Dental Hospital Tuesday.
					 Being briefed on the hospital which was successfully built as a service center for dental treatment, he looked round several treatment rooms.
					
					 He also toured the Rungna Dolphinarium, Songdowon International Children's Camp, Masikryong Ski Resort, etc.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., Youth League Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C.C., Youth League Held
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The 54th enlarged plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League took place here on Tuesday.
					 The meeting discussed the tasks of the youth league organizations to implement the important tasks set forth in supreme leader Kim Jong Un's letter "Young People, Be Vanguard Fighters Unfailingly Faithful to the Party's Revolutionary Cause of Songun" sent to those attending the Fourth Conference of Primary Officials of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said the letter reflected Kim Jong Un's steadfast will to bring earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, the revolutionary cause of Songun, by giving full play to the inexhaustible might of a great number of the young people.
					
					 They called on all the young people to regard the idea of the letter as the immutable faith and devote all their energies and wisdom to carrying through the important tasks set forth in the letter without an inch of deflection.
					
					 They underscored the need to more firmly establish the party's monolithic leadership system within the youth league and for all the young people to trust and follow Kim Jong Un absolutely and become a fortress and shield to defend the Workers' Party of Korea politically and ideologically and at the risk of their lives.
					
					 Present at the meeting were members of the C.C., the youth league and its officials in Pyongyang and local areas.

articles.title: National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
articles.content:
National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A national seminar took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday to deeply study and grasp the scientific accuracy, truth and tremendous vitality of socialism clarified by leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials of national institutions, party and administrative bodies and working people's organizations in Pyongyang, officials in the fields of science, education, literature and arts, media, party cadre training institutions and those in the field of the preservation of revolutionary relics.
					
					 The seminar heard five papers explaining and proving the validity of scientific and original idea and theory and their tremendous vitality clarified in Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science".
					
					 Kang Jin Hyong, department head of Rodong Sinmun, said in his speech that Kim Jong Il's work is an immortal militant banner and a library of the socialist theory of Juche which instill the faith in sure victory of socialism into the world progressives including the Korean people.
					
					 Dr. and Assistant Prof. Pak Myong Nam, department head of Kim Il Sung University, noted that the socialist theory of Juche scientifically explained, among other things, the essence and advantages of socialism centered on the popular masses and law of its development, thereby clearly proving the validity of the socialist cause and its historic inevitability.
					
					 Dr. So Song Il, director of an institution of the Academy of Social Sciences, stressed that Korean-style socialism is the most advantageous socialism based on the Juche-oriented viewpoint and stand on man and the best and mightiest socialism based on the Juche-oriented viewpoint and stand on the popular masses.
					
					 Kim Chol Man, department head of the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House, said that Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses is true socialism which firmly protects the popular masses' independent position and rights and lead them to fulfill their responsibility and role as masters.
					
					 Assistant Prof. So Kyong Nam, department head of Kim Il Sung Higher Party School, called for fully demonstrating the might of Korean-style socialism,  true to the leadership of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Achievements Made at Academy of Koryo Medicine
articles.content:
Achievements Made at Academy of Koryo Medicine
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Academy of Koryo Medicine are channeling their efforts into researches into traditional medicine.
					 Its researchers and doctors produced a system for earlier diagnosis of functions of internal organs.
					
					 They wrote dozens of papers conducive to giving full play to the characteristics and advantages of Koryo medicine, paying off profusely in preventive treatment.
					
					 They are properly combining Koryo medicine with modern medicine and scientifically applying Koryo medicines, acupuncture, moxibustion and cupping to suit to diseases and constitutions of patients, and thus registering achievements in treatment. They are also producing efficacious Koryo medicines by themselves and using them for clinical study and medical care.
					
					 Koryo medical service support system, multi-media dictionary and other programs have been developed to put Koryo medical treatment on a scientific and IT basis.
					
					 Tens of reference books have been written and published to contribute to preventing diseases and protecting health by Koryo medicinal methods and at least 20 kinds of Koryo medicine materials equivalent to vitamin C have also been found out.

articles.title: National Software Contest and Exhibition Close
articles.content:
National Software Contest and Exhibition Close
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The 25th National Software Contest and Exhibition closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Tuesday.
					 Application programs for Korean-style operating system, machine translation programs and devices and elements needed for putting production processes on a CNC and automation basis which were presented by Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and other educational institutions and units developing programs drew keen interest of the participants.
					
					 Highly appreciated were the programs presented by the State Academy of Sciences, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Tukjang Youth Coal Mine of the Tukjang Area Coal Mining Complex and other ministries and national institutions and industrial establishments which contributed to putting business activities on an IT basis  and production processes on a  CNC basis to boost production efficiency.
					
					 Brisk exchange of IT-based products and service took place during the exhibition. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, officials concerned and program developers.

articles.title: DPRK's Deep-sea Fishing Fleet Returns
articles.content:
DPRK's Deep-sea Fishing Fleet Returns
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The deep-sea fishing fleet of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea returned home after finishing the fishing of nearly 100 days in Russia's maritime territorial waters.
					 In the period, the fleet increased the fish catch 25 percent over last year's.
					
					 Song Chun Sop, chief engineer of the Sinpho Deep Sea Fishery Complex, told KCNA that this year the fleet began its deep-sea fishing 45 days earlier than last year and it consisted of scores of high-performance vessels and factory ships.

articles.title: Telemedicine Service Proves Effective in DPRK
articles.content:
Telemedicine Service Proves Effective in DPRK
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Telemedicine service system established in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has been proving effective with each passing day.
					 Kim Man Yu Hospital, in particular, renders creditable telemedicine service to county and provincial hospitals across the country, performing online surgical operations.
					
					 Jo Won Chol, a section chief of the hospital, told KCNA that such telemedicine service is given on the basis of advance analysis of patients' clinical charts through e-mail.
					
					 He further said:
					
					 The system, run at government expense, has come under spotlight among world's medical workers.
					
					 Participants in the WHO South-East Asia Regional Technical Consultation on Telemedicine, which took place here last year, admired the system, because it was established throughout the country in a short span of time on a high level and the service is given free of charge to all the people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lays Bare Purpose of U.S. "Human Rights" Campaign against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lays Bare Purpose of U.S. "Human Rights" Campaign against DPRK
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article says that the aim sought by the U.S. in its campaign is to tarnish the image of the DPRK by internationalizing its non-existent "human rights" issue and, furthermore, bring down by force of arms the social system and ideology chosen by the Korean people themselves.
					 The article goes on: 
					
					 It is the U.S. trite method to find fault with the "human rights issue" in the countries that incur its displeasure, pull up them over the issue and interfere in their internal affairs and topple their regimes. 
					
					 The U.S. used this method for tarnishing the image of the socialist countries and bringing them down.
					
					 In recent years legitimate governments were toppled and replaced by pro-U.S., pro-West ones in some countries of Europe and Mideast owing to the U.S. "human rights" offensive.
					
					 It is a major method of fighting wars of aggression employed by the U.S. that it makes much fuss about "human rights" performance in other countries by exaggerating and internationalizing it and hurls huge troops into operations against it under the pretext of "championing human rights" when an opportunity presents itself and overthrows the legitimate sovereign state overnight.
					
					 The wars in Grenada, Panama, former Yugoslavia, etc. in the 80s and the 90s of the last century were fought without exception under the pretext of "championing the human rights". The same can be said of the wars in Afghanistan, Iraq and some other countries in the Mideast in the new century.
					
					 History teaches the lesson that the U.S. "human rights" offensive is always accompanied by military intervention for aggression.
					
					 The U.S. anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign is not a temporary one but a long-standing strategy prompted by its inveterate hostility towards the DPRK.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never allow the U.S. "human rights" campaign.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses Aims Sought by U.S. in Its Campaign for Wiping out "IS"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses Aims Sought by U.S. in Its Campaign for Wiping out "IS"
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Demands for bombs, rockets and aircraft parts are rapidly increasing owing to the strike operations of the U.S. air force against the "IS" and the stock market of the U.S. munitions monopolies is sharply rising, according to foreign press reports. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This indicates that the war fought by the U.S. under the signboard of punitive operations against the "IS" is nothing but military actions to meet the interests of the U.S. munitions monopoly capitalists and bring bigger profits to them. 
					
					 It is the physiological character of imperialism that it cannot exist even a single day without aggression and war.
					
					 As shown by the history of wars in the 20th century such as the Korean war in the 1950s, the Vietnam war in the 1960s and aggression against Cambodia in the 1970s, the U.S. has been engrossed in aggressions and wars. 
					
					 It is the trite method of the U.S. to perpetrate aggression and war even by deliberately inventing pretexts.
					
					 A typical example was the Iraqi war.
					
					 The U.S. punitive operations against the "IS" are not an exception.
					
					 The mid-term Congress election is slated to take place in the U.S. soon. It is the common sense that the Democratic Party can hardly win the fight against the Republican Party without the backing of the monopoly capitalists and munitions industries.
					
					 Therefore, the Obama administration is implementing its policies in the direction of protecting the interests of the monopoly capitalists and munitions industries.
					
					 Facts go to clearly prove why global peace and stability are wrecked and who is the arch criminal.
					
					 The U.S. should clearly understand that it is fated to meet its doom though it has grown fat through wars.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Censured for Giving up Right to OPECON
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Censured for Giving up Right to OPECON
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- South Korean people from all walks of life condemned the puppet authorities for giving up the right to wartime operation control (OPECON), according to CBS of south Korea.
					 At least 50 organizations including the Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a press conference outside the Ministry of Defence on Oct. 24. They strongly demanded the cancellation of the agreement, saying that the extension of the transfer of the right to OPECON is an act of infringing upon the interests of the people and seriously threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The Reunification Association of the Citizens Federation for Economic Justice in a statement said that overturning the agreement on extending the transfer twice is an international shame.
					
					 There is great likelihood that the U.S. will pressurize south Korea to join in the missile defense system and deploy THAAD there in the future in return for deferring the transfer, the statement noted.

articles.title: Gun-related Accident Occurs in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Gun-related Accident Occurs in S. Korean Puppet Army
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A gun-related accident occurred at a coastal post of a unit of the puppet ground force of south Korea in Kangrung, south Korean Kangwon Province on Oct. 25.
					 A corporal was wounded, hit by a bullet fired from his rifle.

articles.title: Punishment of Criminals Who Scattered Anti-DPRK Leaflets Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Criminals Who Scattered Anti-DPRK Leaflets Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Environment Movement Association of south Korea on Oct. 26 demanded the punishment of those criminals who scattered anti-DPRK leaflets, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 The conservative organizations' criminal act of scattering hundreds of thousands of leaflets into the sky above the DPRK deserves punishment as it is an act of throwing away wastes, the organization said.
					
					 It reported the representative of the "Alliance for the Movement of Free North" and others to the police.
					
					 It warned that it would report to the local autonomous organizations, Ministry of Environment, prosecution, etc. conservative organizations on charges of violation of the "law on control of wastes" in case they continue scattering leaflets.

articles.title: Action for Probing Truth about Disaster and Abolishing Part-time Job Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Probing Truth about Disaster and Abolishing Part-time Job Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Rallies took place in Seoul on Oct. 25 demanding the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster and the abolition of part-time job, according to CBS of south Korea.
					 The Measure Committee of the Families of Victims, Missing Persons and Survivors of the Ferry Sewol Sinking Accident of south Korea held a candlelight rally in demand of the institution of a special law to probe the truth about the big disaster.
					
					 Holding placards and candlelights, the participants of the rally demanded the institution of a special law which grants the right to investigate and indict as called for by the bereaved families.
					
					 The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a workers rally at which they declared they would stage an action for abolishing the part-time job. It stated that workers would come out in the actions in demand of the settlement of the labor issue including the dismissal, the abolition of part-time job and halt to the moves to destroy trade unions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to be Remembered in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to be Remembered in Switzerland
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A Swiss committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Basel on October 21 to observe the third anniversary of his demise. 
					 Martin Loecher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee. 
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from Nov. 1 to Dec. 20 and decided to widely introduce the works and undying exploits of Kim Jong Il and hold colorful events including a meeting, seminar and film show.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in UK
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A British committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was formed at the building of the New Communist Party of Britain on October 21. 
					 Andy Brooks, general secretary of the Central Committee of the New Communist Party of Britain, was elected chairman of the memorial committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to publish and disseminate works of Kim Jong Il and organize memorial events including a seminar between Nov. 1 and Dec. 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Mexico
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A Mexican national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed at the building of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico on October 21. 
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee. 
					
					 The committee decided to hold a meeting, seminar, lecture and other political and cultural events on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Swiss Organization
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A Swiss committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise issued a statement at its inaugural ceremony on Oct. 21.
					 The statement said;
					
					 Kim Jong Il, tender-hearted father of the Korean people, was the outstanding thinker and theoretician, great leader of the party, state and army and iron-willed brilliant commander possessed of the gifted stratagem and matchless grit.
					
					 He performed the undying feats to go down in the history of the country by loyally carrying forward the revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He formulated the three charters for national reunification and provided the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration, thus ushering in the historic June 15 era of reunification in which the Koreans advanced in the patriotic idea of By the Korean Nation Itself.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its might and dignity as a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear weapons state and emerged an invulnerable socialist fortress thanks to the Songun politics enforced by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Nigerian Lawmaker
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Nigerian Lawmaker
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- A senator of the National Assembly of Nigeria was interviewed by media persons of various countries on Oct. 21 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 He said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, was the master of independent politics to be specially recorded in the world history of politics.
					
					 He thoroughly applied the Juche idea, the idea guiding the cause of independence, to the revolution and construction.
					
					 When socialism collapsed in various countries, the DPRK stood unfazed thanks to his transparent line of independence.
					
					 What is the most important of his exploits is that he established the mode of Songun politics. 
					
					 It was thanks to the Songun politics that the defence capability of the country was remarkably bolstered up and the DPRK could demonstrate its might as a military power which no formidable enemy dared provoke. 
					
					 The Korean people will surely win the final victory in the drive for building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who has successfully carried forward and accomplished the idea and cause of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK-proposed Federal Formula Supported in Indonesia
articles.content:
DPRK-proposed Federal Formula Supported in Indonesia
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian Merdeka News Agency on Oct. 20 under the title "Federal formula is most realistic proposal for Korea's reunification" conveyed the accounts of the talk between Rachmawati Soekarnoputri, chairwoman of the Founding Committee of the Soekarno Foundation for Education of Indonesia, and Peter Woods, co-chairman of the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea.
					 The news agency quoted them as saying that the most realistic way of reunifying the Korean peninsula is to accept the federal formula now that there exist in the north and the south of Korea differing ideologies and social systems and both are asserting their own social systems.
					
					 The DPRK has made a lot of efforts to achieve the peaceful reunification of the peninsula.
					
					 The issue of Korea's reunification should be decided by the Koreans themselves under any circumstances.
					
					 The confrontation between the north and the south is the one of reunification formulas. Any action obstructive to Korea's reunification is intolerable.
					
					 The world backs Korea's reunification.
					
					 Peter Woods expressed the will to positively let the world community know about the DPRK's proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula.
					
					 Rachmawati Soekarnoputri called for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea.
					
					 Noting that the U.S. forces in south Korea are a key factor of escalating the tension on the peninsula, she said it is hard to expect constructive peace talks between the north and the south unless the U.S. forces withdraw from south Korea. The U.S. should withdraw its forces from south Korea at once in order to ensure peace and security on the peninsula and achieve the peaceful reunification of Korea, she held.

articles.title: DIU Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DIU Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign media observed the 88th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU) by President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The Indonesian newspaper Suara Karya on Oct. 15 carried an article titled "'DIU' and Workers' Party of Korea" which said as follows:
					
					 The long course traversed by the Korean revolution since the formation of the DIU nearly nine decades ago was the period in which the Korean people have won victory, advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism pioneered by the DIU.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) has built and consistently strengthened socialism true to the great idea and goal put forth by the DIU. 
					
					 An internet website of Indonesia also posted an article with similar contents. 
					
					 An internet magazine of Italy posted an article titled "Formation day of 'DIU'" on Oct. 17. 
					
					 The magazine introduced in detail the fact that Kim Il Sung embarked upon the road of the revolution in his early years and formed the DIU, a genuine revolutionary organization of Juche type. 
					
					 The tradition and cause of the DIU will be immortal and the future of Songun Korea will be rosy forever thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the magazine added.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK and the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on Oct. 16 and 17 posted on their websites articles saying that the WPK has invariably advanced along the road of independence, Songun and socialism.

articles.title: En Brazzaville Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
En Brazzaville Kim Yong Nam
Brazzaville, 27 de octubre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, arribo el dia 27 a esta capital de la Republica del Congo para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad al pais africano.
					Le acompanaron el ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, So Kil Bok, etc.
					
					Con anterioridad, Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva partieron el dia 26 de la Republica de Sudan.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con presidentes de Senado y Asamblea Nacional de Congo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con presidentes de Senado y Asamblea Nacional de Congo
Brazzaville, 27 de octubre (Corresponsal de ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, de visita oficinal y de amistad en la Republica del Congo, departio el dia 27 en un  ambiente amistoso en la sede del parlamento con los presidentes del Senado y la Asamblea Nacional del Congo, respectivamente. 
					En la ocasion el presidente del Senado senalo que el pueblo congoleno venera a Su Excelencia Presidente Kim Il Sung quien envio en el pasado el apoyo y ayuda por la independencia del Congo y admira a la firme voluntad del pueblo coreano que avanza hacia el camino de la independencia.
					
					El presidente de la Asamblea Nacional expreso su conviccion de que la presente visita de Kim contribuira al desarrollo de las relaciones entre los dos paises.
					
					El mismo dia, el presidente de la Asamblea Nacional de Congo ofrecio un banquete en honor del presidente Kim Yong Nam.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa agradecimiento al presidente sudanes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa agradecimiento al presidente sudanes
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 26 un mensaje de agradecimiento al presidente de la Republica del Sudan, Omar Hassan Ahmed al-Bashir, al partir de este pais  africano tras cumplir su visita.
					El remitente expreso agradecimiento al mandatario, gobierno y pueblo de Sudan que le dieron calurosa bienvenida y le acogieron cordialmente.
					
					Subrayo que durante su visita intercambiaron las opiniones utiles para seguir fortaleciendo con vigor las relaciones bilaterales y otros problemas de interes comun y lograron una serie  de acuerdos.
					
					Senalo que siente muy agradecido de que la realizacion exitosa de la visita al Sudan sirvio de un motivo importante para impulsar aun mas el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales entre ambos  paises.
					
					Deseo que el gobierno y el pueblo de Sudan logren exitos en la integridad territorial del pais, el aseguramiento de seguridad, el desarrollo de economia y la mejora de vida del pueblo bajo la acertada direccion del presidente y que el destinatario tenga buena salud y alcance mayores exitos en sus trabajos.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela fines comerciales de guerra contra Estado Islamico
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela fines comerciales de guerra contra Estado Islamico
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- Segun las fuentes extranjeras, como resultado de la operacion de ataque aereo de Estados Unidos contra el Estado Islamico, aumentan bruscamente las demandas sobre las bombas, cohetes y piezas de avion y se eleva considerablemente la cotizacion de las acciones de los monopolios de industria belica de ese pais.
					Esto demuestra que la guerra contra el Estado Islamico no pasa de ser una accion militar que representa los intereses de los capitalistas monopolistas, o sea, enriquecerlos aun mas.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y continua:
					
					No puede existir ni un dia sin la agresion y guerra, esto es la caracteristica fisiologica del imperialismo.
					
					Solo en el siglo 20, EE.UU. continuo cada ano la agresion y la guerra, por ejemplo, la guerra coreana de la decada de 1950, la vietnamita de la decada de 1960, la agresion a Camboya en la decada de 1970, etc.
					
					Para lanzar la guerra y la agresion, EE.UU. inventa los pretextos si no los tiene.
					
					Se puede citar como ejemplo la guerra contra Irak.
					
					En EE.UU. se realizaran pronto las elecciones intermediarias del Congreso.  
					
					Todos conocen que la victoria del gobernante Partido Democratico frente al Partido Republicano es imposible sin el apoyo de los capitalistas monopolistas y los complejos de industria belica.
					
					Por eso, la actual administracion Obama elabora y ejecuta las politicas en direccion de defender los intereses de ellos.
					
					La realidad comprueba por que se perturban la paz y la estabilidad del mundo y quien es el culpable.
					
					EE.UU. debe conocer bien que aunque se ha enriquecido en las guerras, sera arruinado tambien en ellas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela proposito de campana anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela proposito de campana anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 28 de octubre (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este martes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que el proposito de la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de EE.UU. es manchar la imagen de ella internacionalizando el inexistente "problema de DDHH" y eliminar por via militar el regimen y la idea optados por el pueblo coreano, y continua:
					EE.UU. tiene el vicio de cuestionar los defectos de derechos humanos de los paises, que no le agradan, y derrocar el poder de ellos luego de intervenir en sus asuntos internos 
					
					El mismo metodo fue utilizado para derrumbar a los paises socialistas.
					
					En los ultimos anos, en algunos paises de Europa y el Medio Oriente cayeron los poderes legitimos y se fundaron los gobiernos proyanquis y prooccidentales.
					
					Bajo el vistoso cartel de "defensa de DDHH", se desataron las guerras contra Granadas, Panama y ex Yugoslavia en la decada de 1980 y la de 1990. En el nuevo siglo, se convirtieron en victimas Afganistan, Irak y otros paises del Medio Oriente.
					
					La historia ensena la leccion de que la campana de "DDHH" de EE.UU. termina sin falta con la intervencion militar.
					
					La misma campana anti-RPDC no es la temporal sino la estrategia prolongada que parte de la hostilidad anti-RPDC.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de Corea no la perdonaran jamas.
